      • get1DIndex

        public int get1DIndex()
        Returns:
        the absolute index of the turtle's location in a 1D data grid representing a 2D grid of width * height size. Its purpose is to be used on a Pheromone to optimize several calls on its data structure.

      • get1DIndex

        public int get1DIndex(int x,
             int y)
        Parameters:
        x - absolute
        y - absolute
        Returns:
        the absolute index in a 1D data grid representing a 2D grid of width,height size. This should be used with xcor() and ycor() to ensure that this x,y point in inside the environment's boundaries. Its purpose is to be used on a Pheromone

      • getNearestTurtle

        public Turtle getNearestTurtle(int inRadius)
        Returns the nearest turtle from this one within the inRadius-vicinity as a patch distance.
        Parameters:
        inRadius -
        Returns:
        the corresponding turtle or null there is no turtle around. In case of equality between turtles (same patch distance or same patch), the first found is returned.

      • getNearestTurtle

        public <T extends Turtle> T getNearestTurtle(int patchRadius,
                                    Class<T> turtleType)
        Returns the nearest turtle of type T from this one according to its patch distance.
        Parameters:
        patchRadius - the side length of the square of patches to look into
        Returns:
        the corresponding turtle or null if there is no turtle of this type around. In case of equality between turtles (same patch distance or same patch), the first found is returned.

      • getNearestTurtleWithRole

        public <T extends Turtle> T getNearestTurtleWithRole(int patchRadius,
                                            String role,
                                            Class<T> turtleType)
        Returns the nearest turtle of type T from this one according to its patch distance.
        Parameters:
        patchRadius - the side length of the square of patches to look into
        Returns:
        the corresponding turtle or null if there is no turtle of this type around. In case of equality between turtles (same patch distance or same patch), the first found is returned.

      • getNearestTurtleWithRole

        public Turtle getNearestTurtleWithRole(int patchRadius,
                              String role)
        Returns the nearest turtle of type T from this one according to its patch distance.
        Parameters:
        patchRadius - the side length of the square of patches to look into
        Returns:
        the corresponding turtle or null if there is no turtle of this type around. In case of equality between turtles (same patch distance or same patch), the first found is returned.

      • getNearestTurtle

        public <T extends Turtle> T getNearestTurtle(double realRadius,
                                    Class<T> turtleType)
        Returns the nearest turtle of type T from this one according to its real distance.
        Parameters:
        realRadius - the maximum distance of the returned turtle
        turtleType - the type of turtle to seek
        Returns:
        the corresponding turtle or null if there is no turtle of this type around. In case of equality between turtles (same patch distance or same patch), the first found is returned.

      • setHeadingTowardsNoWrap

        public void setHeadingTowardsNoWrap(Turtle t)

      • setHeadingTowards

        public void setHeadingTowards(Turtle t)
        Set the heading toward the turtle t. This has no effect if this turtle and t have exactly the same coordinates.
        Parameters:
        t - a turtle

      • setHeadingTowards

        public void setHeadingTowards(Turtle t,
                     double offset)
        Set the heading toward the turtle t. This has no effect if this turtle and t have exactly the same coordinates.
        Parameters:
        t - a turtle
        offset - the angle to add to the corresponding direction

      • towards

        public double towards(Turtle t)

      • towardsNoWrap

        public double towardsNoWrap(Turtle t)

      • towardsNoWrap

        public double towardsNoWrap(double a,
                   double b)

      • towards

        public double towards(double a,
             double b)
        returns direction to the patch (a,b). If the "wrapped distance", when wrap mode is on, (around the edges of the screen) is shorter than the "onscreen distance," towards will report the direction of the wrapped path, otherwise it while will report the direction of the onscreen path

      • distanceNoWrap

        public double distanceNoWrap(double xCoordinate,
                    double yCoordinate)
        return the "on screen distance" between the turtle and the coordinates (a,b).
        Returns:
        a distance as a double

      • distance

        public double distance(double a,
              double b)
        returns the distance from the patch (a,b). The "wrapped distance", when wrap mode is on, (around the edges of the screen) if that distance is shorter than the "onscreen distance."
        Parameters:
        a - the a
        b - the b
        Returns:
        the distance as a double

      • distance

        public double distance(Turtle t)

        public int getCurrentBehaviorCount()
        When the turtle switches its behavior the value of this counter is 0
        Returns:

      • executeThisTurtle

        protected static void executeThisTurtle(int nbOfInstances,
                     String... args)
        This offers a convenient way to create a main method that launches a simulation containing the turtle class under development. This call only works in the main method of the turtle.
        Parameters:
        args - MaDKit or TurtleKit options
        Since:
        TurtleKit 3.0.0.1
        See Also:
        AbstractAgent.executeThisAgent(int, boolean, String...)
